name: lime production, milled, loose | lime | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/11720/documentation

This dataset represents the production of milled / pulverized limestone.;;Diesel and electricity consumption was provided by the only lime producer in Quebec. No water use reported for this activity. A weighted average of their three (3) limestone plants is used. ;;Pulverized limestone (lime, milled, loose) includes all products which are made by grinding and screening industrial grade limestone.;;These products are used in a variety of applications including:;- Rock Dust - used to suppress coal dust explosions in the coal industry.;- Agricultural - used to neutralize soil acidity, increase plant nutrients, increase organic matter, increase soil organisms, and increase trace elements. ;- Exhaust Gas Scrubbers - used in industrial and power plants.;- Scrubber Reagent - used in circulating fluidized bed boilers as a reagent material for sulfur removal.;- Roofing Materials - used as a filler in asphalt shingles.;- Drilling Mud Additives - used as an essential component in drilling mud.;- Glass Stone - used as a primary ingredient in the glass making process.;- Feed Supplements - used to provide essential minerals for the animal feed industry. ;;Infrastructure data was extrapolated from "lime production, milled, loose, GLO 2002" ecoinvent dataset: The value of the infrastructure is normalized with a annual production capacity of about 6'000 tons of product per year. The estimated lifespan of the machines is 25 years. There are no dust emissions as the mill is a closed system.

From crushed limestone

This activity ends with the milled lime, at the plant gate.

This dataset includes the processes: milling, sieving, filtering, drying and storing. One part of the total heating energy for "production" and "administration" is included. Equipment included in the infrastructure: 1 crusher, 1 sieve, and 2 small silos and 1 filter.
category: B:Mining and quarrying/08:Other mining and quarrying/081:Quarrying of stone, sand and clay/0810:Quarrying of stone, sand and clay

processDocumentation.geographyDescription: Quebec data are from the only company that produces limestone on the territory. Unavalable data were extrapolated based on the GLO dataset exchanges.
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: The company works on a technically high level; heavy machines (excl. building machines) are operated electrically; air is recirculated in closed loop to avoid dust emissions
processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription:
A weighted average of three lime production plants in Quebec was used.
When no information available, GLO exchanges have been used as proxy for Quebec. The uncertainty has been adjusted accordingly.
 
See Geography and Technolgy fields for details.
processDocumentation.samplingDescription: Information provided by the only Quebec producer
